results.title: Deconstructing Harry
results.creator_credit: Magnolia Productions, Sweetland Films BV, Jean Doumanian and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Harry (Woody Allen), a New York author, has just released his latest novel “loosely” based on the characters from his own life - his ex-wives, mistresses, family and analysts. No-one likes his depiction of them, and in an hilariously ironic mixture of flashbacks to his new novel, flashbacks to his past, and mishaps in the present, the true story comes out. In classic Allen style, this autobiographical story is a fascinating mixture of fiction and reality. The cast is another line-up of characters in itself, including Kirstie Alley, Demi Moore, Robin Williams, Billy Crystal, Elisabeth Shue, Stanley Tucci, Amy Irving, Julie Kavner, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Mariel Hemingway and Judy Davis.

results.title: Decoder
results.brief_description: The behaviour of the people in the Western World is being altered by an aural weapon devised to subconsciously affect those exposed to it. This artificial product, created by scientists, musicians and marketing experts is called “Musak” or “functional music”. The authors of this film carried out intensive research before making “Decoder” as the function of “musak” is to stimulate or soothe, enhancing wellbeing by constructing a particular tonal sequence. “Musak” by its very nature has an undoubted political significance. This production blends reality and fiction: surreal, metaphorical imagery interwoven with music.

results.title: Decisive discipline: every move you make
results.creator_credit: Bill Rogers and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description: A kit produced by Bill Rogers and the Institute of Educational Administration which advocates certain decisive discipline strategies which could be utilised by a classroom teacher. The kit consists of two videotapes and an accompanying booklet which provides background information and print summaries from the videotapes. Highlights some classroom discipline problems and strategies for dealing with them.

results.title: Decisions, Decisions! (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Illustrates problems managers can encounter when failing to approach decision making and implementation logically. Demonstrates the importance of utilising the knowledge and views of the team when deciding on matters affecting them. Famous decision makers from the past, Brutus, Queen Elizabeth I, Churchill and Montgomery, act as a review panel and confront an incompetent manager with his mistakes. Features John Cleese and Prunella Scales. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Decision for chemistry
results.creator_credit: MPO Productions, Monsanto Chemical Company and Sidney Meyers
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of the chemical industry and its role in everyday living. Mentions the development of fire-resistant materials, treatment of soil with phosphates and Krilium products; the use of detergents in the laundry industry; the development of new textile fibres; and research on radio-active materials. For modern youth, with an enquiring mind, wonderful opportunities for a worth-while career are offered by the chemical industry.

results.title: Deciding to organize
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB and Bonnie Sherr Klein
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Organizing for Power”.
Produced as a part of the Challenge for Change Program, this series examines Saul Alinsky’s method of organizing communities into effective action units based on participation democracy. A group of concerned citizens from Dayton, Ohio, consult Alinsky on means of creating an effective organization.
